pr_title: [BEAM-5504] Add Avro support to Pubsub table provider

timeline.message: Change table type name in avro
Move the payloadFormat selection to TBLPROPERTIES
Move the payloadFormat selection to TBLPROPERTIES
Move the payloadFormat selection to TBLPROPERTIES

timeline.bodyText: Is this fixing a bug where field order isn't maintained? If so we should break it out into a separate PR
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

replies.bodyText: You're definitely right, I've done it here:  #12928
replies.author: piotr-szuberski

timeline.message: [BEAM-10857] Add Avro support to Pubsub table provider

timeline.bodyText: These functions should directly verify the Avro data rather than converting to a Row if possible
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

replies.bodyText: We should do this for the other matcher* methods as well.
replies.author: TheNeuralBit

timeline.bodyText: Can this be an inner class of PubsubSchemaIOProvider?
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

+package org.apache.beam.sdk.io.gcp.pubsub;
+
+public enum PayloadFormat {
+  JSON,
+  AVRO
+}

timeline.bodyText: I think it would be preferable to define our own ParseException that parsePayload throws. Then parsePayload can catch these exceptions specific to the format that is being used, and throw it with the format-specific exception as the cause. That way the calls to parsePayload just need to check for ParseException
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

timeline.bodyText:
I think it may be better to just get rid of this test. I added it as a stepping stone when I was adding support for writing JSON to PubSub (see #9880). But it's just adding unnecessary complexity to keep it around now, the write path is thoroughly tested end-to-end in the tests below this one.
If we get rid of this you won't need applyRowsToStrings
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

timeline.bodyText: messageIdName, matcherNames, and matcherNameHeight should avoid using AvroUtils.getRowToAvroBytesFunction as well.
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

timeline.bodyText: Instead of eagerly generating the avroBytesToRowFn (even if we won't need it) and then branching on the payloadFormat for every element  in parsePayload, we should instead generate a parsePayload function when it's needed. This could work similarly to what the current version does withobjectMapper, except we would create and store a Function<PubsubMessage, Row>. In the JSON case we'd generate the ObjectMapper and wrap that in a function, and in the Avro case we'd call getAvroBytesToRowFunction and wrap it.
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

replies.bodyText: Done. Indeed it's much clearer now!
replies.author: piotr-szuberski

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure why I opted to get ISO_8859_1 encoded bytes here... Could you change this to use UTF_8?
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

timeline.message: [BEAM-5504] Add Avro support to Pubsub table provider
make matcherNameHeightKnowsJS in avro return avro data
Use generic record to generate avro bytes
Use throws to the methods signatures instead of rethrowing an exception
